name: Tokyo Tower
description: An iconic red-and-white tower offering panoramic views of Tokyo and a small amusement area at its base.

name: Senso-ji Temple
description: Tokyo's oldest and most famous Buddhist temple, known for its giant lantern and bustling shopping street, Nakamise-dori.

name: Shibuya Crossing
description: The world-famous busy pedestrian crossing, a must-see spot for experiencing Tokyo's vibrant city life.

name: Meiji Shrine
description: A peaceful Shinto shrine surrounded by a lush forest, dedicated to Emperor Meiji and Empress Shoken.

name: Ueno Zoo
description: Japan's oldest zoo, home to pandas, tigers, and a wide variety of animals, located in scenic Ueno Park.

name: Tokyo Skytree
description: A towering observation deck offering breathtaking city views, shopping, and dining options at its base.

name: Odaiba
description: A futuristic man-made island with shopping malls, entertainment complexes, museums, and seaside views.

name: Tsukiji Outer Market
description: Famous for fresh seafood, sushi stalls, and traditional Japanese food items; a paradise for food lovers.

name: Akihabara
description: Tokyo's electronic and otaku culture hub, filled with anime shops, game centers, and electronics stores.

name: Roppongi Hills
description: A modern complex with luxury shopping, art museums, fine dining, and a rooftop observation deck.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: The iconic symbol of Paris, offering panoramic views from its observation decks and a sparkling light show at night.

name: Louvre Museum
description: World-famous museum housing the Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, and thousands of art pieces from ancient to modern times.

name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
description: Historic Gothic cathedral on Île de la Cité, known for its stunning architecture and famous gargoyles.

name: Montmartre & Sacré-Cœur
description: A charming hilltop neighborhood with artistic heritage, cobbled streets, and the beautiful Sacré-Cœur Basilica.

name: Champs-Élysées & Arc de Triomphe
description: Famous avenue lined with shops and cafes, leading to the historic Arc de Triomphe honoring French soldiers.

name: Palace of Versailles
description: Lavish royal palace with sprawling gardens, fountains, and the Hall of Mirrors, a symbol of French monarchy.

name: Sainte-Chapelle
description: A Gothic chapel famous for its stunning stained-glass windows that fill the space with colorful light.

name: Luxembourg Gardens
description: Beautiful gardens with fountains, statues, and tree-lined promenades, perfect for relaxation and picnics.

name: Musee d'Orsay
description: Impressionist art museum housed in a former railway station, featuring works by Monet, Van Gogh, and Renoir.

name: Seine River Cruise
description: Scenic boat cruise along the Seine, offering views of Paris landmarks like Notre-Dame, Eiffel Tower, and Louvre.

name: Statue of Liberty
description: Iconic symbol of freedom and democracy, accessible by ferry with panoramic views of Manhattan.

name: Central Park
description: Sprawling urban park offering walking trails, lakes, gardens, and recreational activities in the heart of Manhattan.

name: Times Square
description: Vibrant hub of neon lights, Broadway theaters, and bustling crowds, known as the 'Crossroads of the World.'

name: Empire State Building
description: Historic skyscraper with observation decks offering breathtaking city views day and night.

name: Brooklyn Bridge
description: Famous suspension bridge connecting Manhattan and Brooklyn, ideal for walking and photography.

name: Metropolitan Museum of Art
description: One of the largest and most prestigious art museums, showcasing global art from ancient to modern times.

name: One World Observatory
description: Observation deck atop One World Trade Center, offering panoramic views and a tribute to 9/11.

name: Rockefeller Center
description: Famous entertainment complex with shopping, dining, the Top of the Rock observation deck, and seasonal ice skating.

name: High Line
description: Elevated linear park built on a former railway, featuring gardens, art installations, and views of the city skyline.

name: Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)
description: Leading museum of modern and contemporary art, featuring works by Van Gogh, Picasso, and Warhol.

name: India Gate
description: A war memorial honoring soldiers, surrounded by gardens and a popular spot for evening strolls.

name: Red Fort
description: Historic Mughal fort with impressive red sandstone walls and museums showcasing India’s history.

name: Qutub Minar
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, the tallest brick minaret in the world, adorned with intricate carvings.

name: Lotus Temple
description: A Bahá'í House of Worship famous for its lotus-like architecture and serene meditation environment.

name: Humayun's Tomb
description: Mughal-era mausoleum and UNESCO site, known for its beautiful gardens and Persian-style architecture.

name: Akshardham Temple
description: Grand Hindu temple complex with intricate carvings, exhibitions, and a musical fountain show.

name: Connaught Place
description: A central business and shopping hub with colonial architecture, markets, cafes, and restaurants.

name: Jama Masjid
description: One of India’s largest mosques, built by Shah Jahan, with impressive domes and a large courtyard.

name: Raj Ghat
description: The memorial site of Mahatma Gandhi, surrounded by tranquil gardens and water features.

name: National Museum, New Delhi
description: Showcases India’s rich heritage with artifacts ranging from prehistoric times to modern era.
